Method Detail

driveAngle

public void driveAngle(int angle)
Description copied from interface: Pilot
Telling the pilot to change to a certain direction (angle), relative to the current compass direction. The angle range goes from -180° to 180°. If an angle above 180° is given, it will automatically transform it to the corresponding negative angle.

Specified by:
driveAngle in interface Pilot
Parameters:
angle - the relative angle to the desired compass direction.

holdAngleToWind

public void holdAngleToWind(int angle)
Description copied from interface: Pilot
Telling the pilot to change to a certain direction (angle), relative to the current wind direction. The angle range goes from -180° to 180°. If an angle above 180° is given, it will automatically transform it to the corresponding negative angle.

Specified by:
holdAngleToWind in interface Pilot
Parameters:
angle - The relative angle to the desired wind direction.

driveAngle

private void driveAngle(int angle,
                        DriveAngleMode mode)

setPropellor

public void setPropellor(int value)
Description copied from interface: Pilot
Directly sets a value for the motor controlling the propellor. If the value is outside of the range of valid values, the command will be ignored.

Specified by:
setPropellor in interface Pilot
Parameters:
value - the value to set for the motor controlling the propellor

setRudder

public void setRudder(int value)
Description copied from interface: Pilot
Directly sets a value for the motor controlling the rudder. If the value is outside of the range of valid values, the command will be ignored.

Specified by:
setRudder in interface Pilot
Parameters:
value - the value to set for the motor controlling the rudder

setSail

Description copied from interface: Pilot
Directly sets a value for the motor controlling the sail. If the value is outside of the range of valid values, the command will be ignored.

Specified by:
setSail in interface Pilot
Parameters:
